definitions.dating_raw: Attested from around 1350 to 1470 until the late 15 century.

definitions.definition: Drawn away; removed from; apart from; separate .

examples: Her new film is an abstract piece, combining elements of magic realism, flashbacks, and animation but with very little in terms of plot construction.

subdefinitions.definition: Apart from practice or reality ; vague ; theoretical ; impersonal ; not applied.
As a noun, denoting a concept or intangible as opposed to an object, place, or person.

definitions.definition: Difficult to understand; abstruse ; hard to conceptualize.
examples: The politician gave a somewhat abstract answer when asked about their plans to cut spending.

definitions.definition: Separately expressing a property or attribute of an object that is considered to be inherent to that object: attributive , ascriptive .

Pertaining comprehensively to, or representing , a class or group of objects , as opposed to any specific object; considered apart from any application to a particular object: general , generic , nonspecific ; representational .

definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the early 16 century.

definitions.definition: Pertaining to the formal aspect of art, such as the lines, colors, shapes, and the relationships among them.

subdefinitions.definition: Free from representational qualities, in particular the non-representational styles of the 20 century.
subdefinitions.dating_raw: First attested in the mid 19 century.

definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the mid 19 century.

definitions.definition: Being a partial basis for subclasses rather than a complete template for objects .

main_definition: ( obsolete ) Derived; extracted. [Attested from around 1350 to 1470 until the late 15 century.]
secondary_definitions: ( now rare ) Drawn away; removed from; apart from; separate . [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
Not concrete : conceptual , ideal . [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
Difficult to understand; abstruse ; hard to conceptualize. [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
Separately expressing a property or attribute of an object that is considered to be inherent to that object: attributive , ascriptive . [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]

Pertaining comprehensively to, or representing , a class or group of objects , as opposed to any specific object; considered apart from any application to a particular object: general , generic , nonspecific ; representational . [First attested by Locke in 1689.]
( archaic ) Absent-minded . [First attested in the early 16 century.]
( art ) Pertaining to the formal aspect of art, such as the lines, colors, shapes, and the relationships among them. [First attested in the mid 19 century.]
( object-oriented programming , of a class ) Being a partial basis for subclasses rather than a complete template for objects .
